message.content:
The periodic table is a chart that organizes chemical elements by their atomic number, electron configurations, and recurring chemical properties. Elements are categorized into 18 vertical columns called groups or families and 7 horizontal rows known as periods.

The various categories of the periodic table include:

1. Alkali metals: The alkali metals are located in Group 1 (the first vertical column) of the periodic table, with some examples being lithium (Li), sodium (Na), and potassium (K).

2. Alkaline Earth Metals: These elements belong to Group 2 of the periodic table and include beryllium (Be), magnesium (Mg), calcium (Ca), strontium (Sr), barium(Ba) etc.

3. Transition Metals: Groups between 3 to 12 on the periodic table represent transition metals such as iron(Fe) , copper(Cu) , gold(Au). They exhibit variable oxidation states due to presence of unfilled d orbits.

4. Boron group/ Post-Transition Metals : Elements present under group13 ie boron family includes elements like aluminium(Al) gallium(Ga)

5. Carbon Family -Elements present in group14 consisting carbon which lies at top are know carbon family

6.Chalcogens/The oxygen family(Group16): This group consists ofOxygen(O,Sulfur(S)
7.Halogens(Group17): They are highly reactive non-metals included fluorine(F), chlorine(Cl)
.Group18 inert gases/noble gases contains helium .all members of this gorup have stable full energy orbit hence no tendency tp react .They dont form molecules readily
